problem_statement: Implement a clean, reusable Python module that applies power transformations (Yeo–Johnson and Box–Cox) to reduce skew and stabilize variance in non-Gaussian data, while enforcing method constraints, producing measurable diagnostics (skew/kurtosis/normality tests), and guaranteeing reversible transforms via inverse_transform. Include a small demo on synthetic skewed data and keep the design testable and production-safe.
